newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria inflation drops 0.3 pct up to end of July.
newsitem.headline: Algeria inflation drops 0.3 pct up to end of July.

text.p: Algeria's inflation rate in the first seven months of 1997 up to the end of July was 6.7 percent, down 0.3 of a percentage point from 7.0 percent in the same period last year, the official Algerian news agency APS said on Sunday.

"This evolution confirms the trends of a clear-cut deceleration of the rate of annual inflation in 1997 supported by relatively stable consumer prices and exchange rate," said APS, quoting the National Statistics Office.
Inflation dropped to 18.7 percent in 1996 from 29.8 percent in the previous year, according to official figures.
The government, which had put taming inflation high on its reform agenda, plans to cut the rate to between 7.0 percent and 9.0 percent for the whole of 1997.
